title: How to Make Tex Mex Gazpacho

steps.headline: Prepare your vegetables.
steps.description: Peel, remove the seeds, and finely chop the cucumber, tomatoes, green pepper, and green onion. Keep them aside.

steps.headline: Combine the rest of your ingredients in a water-filled saucepan.
steps.description: Bring it to a boil and simmer.

steps.headline: Add the chopped veggies in the saucepan and cook for 5 minutes on low heat.
Remove it from the heat and let cool.
Place the saucepan in the refrigerator and chill for a few hours.
Remove it from the fridge.
steps.description: Stir the mixture and check the seasoning and consistency.

steps.headline: Fill a saucepan with 1 and 1/2 liters of water.
Add carrots, 50g onions and bouquet garni ( 25g leeks, 12g celery, 6g parsley stalk, 1 bay leaf, a sprig of thyme and 1 tsp peppercorns).
Allow this to simmer on low heat for 2 hours while you keep removing the scum on top.
Strain it through a muslin cloth, and your stock-thick and strong-is ready.

text: Steps Prepare your vegetables. Peel, remove the seeds, and finely chop the cucumber, tomatoes, green pepper, and green onion. Keep them aside. Combine the rest of your ingredients in a water-filled saucepan. Bring it to a boil and simmer. Add the chopped veggies in the saucepan and cook for 5 minutes on low heat.  Remove it from the heat and let cool.  Place the saucepan in the refrigerator and chill for a few hours.  Remove it from the fridge. Stir the mixture and check the seasoning and consistency. Serve in pre-chilled soup bowls.  Preparing the vegetable stock Fill a saucepan with 1 and 1/2 liters of water.  Add carrots, 50g onions and bouquet garni ( 25g leeks, 12g celery, 6g parsley stalk, 1 bay leaf, a sprig of thyme and 1 tsp peppercorns).  Allow this to simmer on low heat for 2 hours while you keep removing the scum on top.  Strain it through a muslin cloth, and your stock-thick and strong-is ready.  Finished.
